title: Type Annotations
description:
Practice adding type annotations to variables and functions.

## Requirements

1. Add type annotations to all variables
2. Add parameter types and return types to all functions
3. Use appropriate types: string, number, boolean, arrays, objects

## Tasks

1. Annotate the person object with proper types
2. Add types to the `formatPerson` function
3. Add types to the `calculateTotal` function
4. Create a properly typed `Product` interface
5. Add types to the `findProduct` function

## Expected Behavior

All code should compile without errors and the IDE should provide proper autocomplete.

testCases.assertion: typeof person.name === 'string' && typeof person.age === 'number' && typeof person.isActive === 'boolean' && Array.isArray(person.hobbies)
typeof formatPerson({ name: 'Test', age: 25, isActive: true, hobbies: ['a'] }) === 'string'

testCases.description: findProduct returns undefined for missing product

testCases.assertion: (function() { const p: Product = {id:1,name:'A',price:1,inStock:true}; return p.tags === undefined; })()

hints: For person: const person: { name: string; age: number; isActive: boolean; hobbies: string[] } = ...
Or create an interface: interface Person { name: string; age: number; ... }
Function syntax: function name(param: Type): ReturnType { }
Optional properties use ?: like tags?: string[]
For findProduct return type: Product | undefined
